title: Vanni Mouse
text:
Vanni Mouse () is a <a href="short%20film">short film</a> produced and directed by <a href="Tamiliam">Tamiliam</a>, a <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20Tamil">Sri Lankan Tamil</a> from the <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20Tamil%20diaspora">diaspora</a>. It won the best award in an international festival. It won the best film award in the fiction category in the nine-day 11th <a href="International%20Short%20and%20Independent%20Film%20Festival">International Short and Independent Film Festival</a> (ISIFF) in <a href="Dhaka">Dhaka</a> 2010. Commenting on the award, Barrister S. J. Joseph of Eelavar Cine Arts Council, based in London, told <a href="TamilNet">TamilNet</a> this was the first time a Sri Lankan Tamil artist had been awarded at an international film festival.
"As far as content is concerned, the film is against violence perpetrated in the name of national integrity. To convey this message, the director picked up a form, which is an interesting combination of <a href="nature%20documentary">wild life cinematography</a>, <a href="surrealistic">surrealistic</a> <a href="Filming%20location">backdrop</a> and realistic incident. A monotonous journey of some mice ends up in an unexpected revelation of a human tragedy. The approach is quite original for <a href="anti-war%20film">anti-war film</a>," said the Jury Recitation during the announcement of the award.
Synopsis.
"Vanni Mouse" is a <a href="short%20film">short film</a> following the journey of two mice which flew from the wood of <a href="Vanni%20%28Sri%20Lanka%29">Vanni</a>. The two inseparable couple end unfortunately in an <a href="internment%20camp">internment camp</a> (<a href="Manik%20Farm">Manik Farm</a>) located in <a href="Vavuniya">Vavuniya</a> (<a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>) where hundreds of thousands <a href="tamils">tamils</a> are imprisoned by the <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20government">Sri Lankan government</a>. These two mice witness the tragedy of many innocent <a href="civilian">civilian</a>s behind the <a href="barbed%20wire">barbed wire</a>s, which remains as unspoken truth. Whether the two will escape from the terrifying environment is the <a href="Climax%20%28narrative%29">climax</a> of this short film.
